metadata.titel_preek: Seventh Sunday After the Epiphany: Romans 1:18–3 / Baptism of the Lord

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God irrupts into the mundane and sinful lives of humans to deliver them from fear and sin, transforming them into participants of His mission.

tekstueel_bewijs: God draws near to them both
the Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all
the firm ground of their salvation

zender.identificatie: The Holy One of Israel / God the Father
tekstueel_bewijs: the source of literally unimaginable promise

ontvanger.identificatie: The Sinful Human (Gideon, Peter, the Homeless, the Hearer)
tekstueel_bewijs: You and I are deep in sin
the young woman who lives in the Port Authority

helper.identificatie: The Angel of the Lord / The Holy Spirit / The Word
tekstueel_bewijs: an angel sitting under a tree
helper.rol_van_god: God is Subject, acting through these means.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help that irrupts into the mundane.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, and Human Resistance (Selfishness, Greed, Idolatry)
tekstueel_bewijs: the price of sin... and every form of human wickedness
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as a power that would leave us 'lost' if allowed to play out; it requires the death of the Son to conquer.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The response of the redeemed: following Christ and 'catching men'.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Redeemed Human (Peter/Gideon/Hearer)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The 'enabling word' must come first to remove fear before the task ('catching men') begins.

voorbeelden_god_subject: the God who terrifies is also the one who loves us
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We are trying to turn ourselves around

voorbeelden: the mighty tasks that lie ahead
We can understand and even admire the hope
the awareness of sin comes only to those...
power to make our resistance go up in flames
sphere of power capable of calling into existence

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Pouvoir' (Power) to act where humans are incompetent (powerless).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Terror) to S1 (Grace) via the 'Fear Not' which negates the death-sentence of S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ takes the S2 (Judgment) upon himself to grant S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; fear is described as 'plain terror' and 'holy dread'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject who initiates, provides the means, and achieves the end, while the human is a passive receiver of 'unmerited' gifts.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Human effort mentioned but immediately subverted
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: He does not ask if we are working to turn ourselves around... he puts redemption into our blanket.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the sole actor in salvation

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: If your rebelliousness and mine were allowed to play themselves out to the end, we would be lost.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Gideon and Peter are not models of virtue to imitate, but examples of human weakness meeting divine grace.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: God chooses the 'nonentity' and the 'sinful man'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; moving from terror to peace.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace; salvation is entirely God's work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'terrifying God' to the 'loving God' is perfectly integrated through the person of Christ.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'heavenly grace' and 'earthly fear'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: paying in his own body the price of sin

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Fatal; leads to being 'lost' without intervention.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. God is the Subject of all redemptive verbs.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is the 'Grammar of Grace'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon avoids the trap of 'exemplarism' and 'moralism' by making the human characters recipients of an irruption they did not initiate.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis might focus on the 'funny' anecdote of Gideon, Greimas shows that Gideon's role is strictly that of an incompetent Subject being endowed with power.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Babylonian context; semiotics explains how the 'New Thing' functions as a narrative 'irruption' that breaks human causality.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'fear of God' is the narrative 'Opponent' that is transformed into a 'Helper' (Wisdom) only when the Subject (God) changes the modality from Devoir to Pouvoir.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'blanket' metaphor to perfectly illustrate the passivity of the Receiver in the primary narrative program.
